title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 502.3 - Assignments
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 502.3 - Assignments

State Regulations
(a) All applications
will be assigned to a presiding officer as soon after filing as is
practicable. (b) The presiding
officer to whom the matter is assigned shall be responsible for the conduct of
a proceeding from the time of the assignment until such time as a report or
recommended decision is submitted to the commissioner, unless the matter is
reassigned based on office needs. During this period any motion by any party
shall be addressed to the presiding officer. The presiding officer shall
determine, unless a hearing is mandated by the Transportation Law, whether a
hearing shall be held; the time and place of any hearing; the manner in which
the record is to be made; the time within which and the place where briefs or
sworn statements are to be submitted, if permitted; and such other matters as
are necessary for the proper discharge of the presiding officer's
responsibility. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17

502.3

New

York State Register March 5, 2025/Volume XLVII, Issue 09, eff. 3/5/2025

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
